metadata.title: CVE-2021-3975 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
segmentation fault during VM shutdown can lead to vdsm hung

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-3975` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-clients - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-config-network - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-iscsi-direct - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-system - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-login-shell - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-sanlock - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt-wireshark - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
libvirt0 - 7.6.0-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.6.0-0ubuntu1').
